data.question: What is the empirical formula of bio-MOF-11?
At what temperature was the X-ray crystal structure of bio-MOF-11 determined?
What is the crystal system of bio-MOF-11?
Does bio-MOF-11 exhibit high CO2 uptake?
Is the space group of bio-MOF-11 I 41/a?
What is the calculated CO2/N2 selectivity of bio-MOF-11 at 273 K?
Was the structure of bio-MOF-11 solved via direct methods?
What is the maximum CO2 uptake of bio-MOF-11 at 1 bar and 273 K?
Is the isosteric heat of adsorption for CO2 in bio-MOF-11 approximately 45 kJ/mol at the onset of adsorption?
What is the estimated Brunauer−Emmett−Teller (BET) surface area of bio-MOF-11?
Does bio-MOF-11 remain stable upon heating to 200 °C?
What is the role of adenine in the synthesis of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: It acts as a biomolecular building block.

data.question: What is the significance of the Lewis basic amino and pyrimidine groups in bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: They contribute to the material's high CO2 adsorption properties.

data.question: Was the crystal of bio-MOF-11 mounted on a glass loop with fluorolube for data collection?
What is the void percentage of the unit-cell volume in bio-MOF-11?
Does bio-MOF-11 have a high selectivity for CO2 over N2 due to narrow pore apertures?
What method was used for absorption correction in the crystallographic study of bio-MOF-11?
What is the role of cobalt acetate tetrahydrate in the synthesis of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: It reacts with adenine to form the MOF structure.

data.question: Is the adsorption of CO2 in bio-MOF-11 completely reversible at 273 K?
What is the significance of the paddle-wheel clusters in the structure of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: They are used for constructing structurally rigid and permanently porous MOFs.
